Activity: Arrive at work, grab a coffee, and check emails. Prioritize emails based on urgency and relevance to the EHR integration project. Skim through industry news related to EHR systems and data collection.

Review the project goal for the week: 'Conduct a thorough assessment of the current EHR system to identify gaps in data collection capabilities related to influenza.' Break down this goal into smaller, actionable tasks.
Initiate assessment of the current EHR system. Focus on modules related to patient intake, diagnosis, medication, and lab results. Document areas that seem relevant to influenza data collection.
Consult the EHR system documentation (if any exists and is up-to-date...likely not) to understand the data structure and available APIs. If documentation is lacking, prepare to reverse engineer.

Start mapping out the data flow for a hypothetical influenza case from patient registration to discharge. Identify potential points where relevant data might be captured or missed. Note the specific tables and fields involved in each step.
Lunch Break - Head to the cafeteria for a quick bite and maybe catch up on some tech blogs.
Resume EHR system assessment. Begin to identify missing data elements that would be crucial for influenza trend analysis (e.g., specific flu strain, vaccination status, etc.).
Draft an email to @clinlead-1 and @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3 to schedule a brief meeting tomorrow to discuss the clinical perspective on influenza data collection and validation of identified data gaps.

Continue exploring the EHR system, focusing on reporting capabilities. See what pre-built reports are available related to respiratory illnesses or influenza. Evaluate their usefulness for trend analysis.

Summarize the findings from today's EHR assessment in a detailed document. Highlight potential data gaps, areas for improvement, and questions for the clinical team. Save this document in a secure location.
Start looking for existing data dictionaries or data models related to healthcare, especially influenza data. Download if available for future analysis.
Wrap up for the day. Back up work and head home.
